# CheerMeUp Project Instructions

This is a Next.js-based "Cheer Me Up" website designed to help job seekers boost their mood after rejections.

## Project Requirements Completed

- ✅ Next.js with TypeScript and App Router
- ✅ Tailwind CSS for responsive design
- ✅ SCSS support for custom styling
- ✅ Four main pages: Home, Support, Actions, and Personality Test
- ✅ Uplifting quotes system
- ✅ Interactive mood-boosting activities
- ✅ Mental health resources and support
- ✅ Fun personality test for job seekers
- ✅ Mobile-responsive design
- ✅ Cheerful color scheme and design

## Development Setup

- Development server: `npm run dev`
- Build: `npm run build`
- Production: `npm run start`
- Linting: `npm run lint`

## Design Guidelines

- Use bright, cheerful colors (yellows, pinks, purples, greens)
- Maintain positive, encouraging tone in all content
- Focus on actionable advice and mood-boosting activities
- Ensure mobile responsiveness
- Include humor and levity where appropriate

## Project Structure

- `/` - Home page with random uplifting quotes
- `/support` - Support resources and affirmations
- `/actions` - Interactive mood-boosting activities
- `/personality-test` - Fun job seeker personality quiz

The project is ready for development and all pages are functional!
